summary: This document is a chain of emails from August-September 2019 between FBI personnel and a Department of Homeland Security agent regarding a request for access to surveillance footage (CCV) from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) for specific dates. The request is related to case 90C-NY-3154599, and the emails show coordination efforts to determine what footage is available for review.

persons.name: Special Agent
persons.role: Federal Bureau of Investigation Special Agent
persons.context: An FBI Special Agent from the New York Office is inquiring about the status of accessing surveillance footage from the MCC for specific dates related to a case.

persons.name: FBI NY CART Coordinator
persons.role: FBI NY Computer Analysis and Response Team Coordinator
persons.context: An FBI NY CART Coordinator responds to an email, stating they are not part of the case and redirects the inquiry to another contact for assistance with the surveillance footage request.

persons.name: Special Agent
persons.role: Federal Protective Service Task Force Officer
persons.context: A Special Agent with the Federal Protective Service (U.S. Department of Homeland Security), assigned as a Task Force Officer to the FBI New York Field Office, makes the initial request for access to MCC surveillance footage for specific dates in 2019.

connections.description: The FBI Special Agent emails the CART Coordinator seeking assistance or status on accessing surveillance footage, indicating a working relationship within the FBI.
The Federal Protective Service agent's request is forwarded to FBI personnel, showing inter-agency coordination on an investigation involving MCC footage.

keyFacts: The emails pertain to FBI case number 90C-NY-3154599.
A formal request was made by a DHS/FPS Task Force Officer to the FBI for access to surveillance footage from the MCC's entry screening area and visitation rooms.
The specific dates for requested footage are May 31, June 14, June 21, July 5, July 26, August 7, and August 14, 2019, during visitation hours.
The request was made in August 2019 and follow-up inquiries were made in September 2019, indicating an active investigation at that time.
The document shows inter-agency coordination between the Department of Homeland Security's Federal Protective Service and the FBI regarding evidence collection.
